official-title.#text: To amend the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to establish a competitive grant program for renewable fuel infrastructure, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Renewable Fuel Utilization, Expansion, and Leadership Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Renewable Fuel Utilization, Expansion, and Leadership Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title IX of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002/t:IX

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a renewable and alternative energy infrastructure competitive grant program to provide grants for renewable and alternative energy infrastructure projects.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002/s:9014/ss:a

text.#text: A project shall be eligible for a grant under

is for new infrastructure or retrofitting existing infrastructure for the dispensing of covered renewable or alternative energy (including pumps, storage tanks, internal tank lining, piping, and electric vehicle chargers) for retail consumption; and
the project will be capable of dispensing fuel containing an amount of covered renewable or alternative energy that is higher than ordinarily found in commerce, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall give priority to projects in rural areas.

text.#text: In awarding grants under this section, the
A grant awarded under this section shall not exceed $100,000.

An entity that receives a grant under this section shall contribute an amount of non-Federal funds towards the project for which such entity receives such grant that is at least equal to 30 percent of the amount of grant funds received by such entity under this section for such project.
From amounts received by the United States each fiscal year as royalties for the production of oil under oil and gas leases granted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , 1 percent shall be available to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 8 of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not affect any requirement to use such amounts to make payments for any other purpose.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002/s:9014/ss:f/p:1

quote.#tail: means renewable energy, energy intended for use in electric vehicle charging, and hydrogen and fuel cells.

header.#text: Covered renewable or alternative energy defined
